many young artists instead want to work
in sculpture or installation or video

2779.49.text:
and while this itself leads to some
interesting new directions in colour,

2785.22.text:
it's hard to imagine that paint has
really nothing more to say about colours.

2791.03.text:
There are still painters who
care deeply about colour,

2795.00.text: but they're few and they're rarely young.

2798.72.text:
In an age where painters seem to have more
choice to materials than ever before,

2806.40.text: But I can't help wondering whether in a way

2808.75.text:
that surplus of choice might
contain the very problem,

2812.53.text: that artists have lost confidence in paint

2815.41.text:
because they no longer
feel they understand it.

2818.80.text:
I can't help but feel sad
at how different this is

2823.13.text:
from the spirit that is
apparent in an account

2826.38.text:
by the photographer Brassai of a
conversation that he had with Picasso.

2833.52.text:
"Then the man in the blue
suit (this is Picasso)

2836.71.text:
reaches into his pocket and
takes out a large sheet of paper

2839.67.text: which he carefully unfolds and hands to me.

2844.85.text: less spasmodic, more studied than usual.

2847.32.text: "At first sight it resembles a poem,

2849.41.text:
20 or so verses are assembled in a column
surrounded by broad white margins.

2854.22.text:
"Each verse is prolonged with a
dash, occasionally a very long one.

2859.75.text:
it is Picasso's most
recent order for colours.

2863.26.text:
"For once, all the anonymous
heroes of Picasso's palette

2866.88.text:
trooped forth from the shadows with
permanent white at their head.

2870.84.text:
"Each had distinguished himself
in some great battle:

2873.99.text:
the blue period; the rose
period; cubism, guernica.

2878.44.text: "Each could say, 'I too, I was there'.

2881.78.text:
Picasso reviewing his
old comrades in arms,

2884.49.text: gives to each of them a sweep of his pen,

2886.75.text: a long dash that seems a fraternal salute.

2893.80.text:
cerulean blue, ivory black, cobalt violet
clear and deep. Welcome, welcome."
